com.archibus.context
Class Context

java.lang.Object
  com.archibus.context.Context
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class Context
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

Thread-bound context. Since each HTTP request is handled by a separate thread, each context instance is associated with HTTP request.

getBean

public java.lang.Object getBean(java.lang.String name)
                         throws org.springframework.beans.BeansException
Returns an instance, which may be shared or independent, of the specified bean. The call will be delegated to the Spring applicationContext.

BeanFactory.getBean(String)

Parameters:
name - the name of the bean to retrieve.
Returns:
an instance of the bean.
Throws:
org.springframework.beans.factory.NoSuchBeanDefinitionException - if there is no bean definition with the specified name.
org.springframework.beans.BeansException - if the bean could not be obtained.

BeanFactory.containsBean(String)

Parameters:
name - The bean name.
Returns:
True if the bean exists.

getEventHandler

public java.lang.Object getEventHandler(java.lang.String name)
Returns the event handler specified by name. The event handler can be defined as a Spring service bean, or loaded by the WFR container from the afm-wf_rules table. This methos first checks the Spring application context, and if the bean is not found there, it checks the WFR container.

Parameters:
name - the event handler name, e.q. CostService.
Returns:
the event handler instance
Throws:
com.archibus.utility.ExceptionBase
